intro: Hiraea faginea f. typica, commonly known as the typical form of the genus Hiraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a food source for specific insect species and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
